author: Robert Hurwitt
title: ‘Life Is a Dream’ takes odd turn as farce
text:
Photo: Fiona McDougall Rosaura (Sango Tajima, left) and her servant Clarin (Michael Wayne Turner III) stumble across Segismundo’s hidden prison in Cutting Ball’s “Life Is a Dream.” Rosaura (Sango Tajima, left) and her servant Clarin (Michael Wayne...
Dreams may be the theme — as in, “We are such stuff as dreams are made on, and our little life is rounded with a sleep,” as Shakespeare put it — but there’s little chance you’ll fall asleep during Cutting Ball Theater’s new version of Pedro Calderón de la Barca’s “Life Is a Dream.” That’s not just because Andrew Saito’s new translation-adaptation is too short for a good snooze. Director Paige Rogers’ staging is so fast, furious and loud that it’s pretty sure to keep you awake. And that’s not necessarily a good thing for the 75-minute play.
